summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from April-May 2021 regarding an FBI 302 report and scheduling an interview with a victim. The emails involve coordination between an attorney and others, referencing the Maxwell trial adjournment and a call from the District Attorney's Office of New York (DANY).

persons.name: C-20
persons.context: Mentioned as wanting to sit in on an interview but being totally swamped, requiring coordination to find availability.

events.title: Meeting with victim
events.description: An attorney mentions they are meeting with a victim the next day and received a call from DANY, wanting to clarify background information beforehand.

events.title: Maxwell trial adjournment
events.description: An email notes that the Maxwell trial has been adjourned, freeing up more time for an individual to be available for an interview.

keyFacts: The emails discuss scheduling an interview related to an FBI 302 report, indicating ongoing investigative or legal proceedings in May 2021.
Reference is made to the Maxwell trial being adjourned, suggesting this correspondence is in the context of the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
A call from the District Attorney's Office of New York (DANY) is mentioned, indicating coordination between federal and state prosecutors.
The identity of the primary correspondents is redacted, with only the attorney 'C-20' being named.
The document shows post-conviction activity regarding victim interviews and legal coordination years after Epstein's death.
